subject: Leadership
title: Empathic Listening
description: A quick, practical guide to Empathic Listening.

hook.text: An employee says 'I'm fine' after a tough project. The leader hears the words but misses the exhaustion underneath.

buildup.text: Empathic listening goes beyond words. It's hearing emotions, reading context, and understanding what isn't being said.

discovery.text: Covey: 'Most people listen to reply, not to understand.' Empathic listeners drop their agenda to enter another's world.

twist.text: Empathy isn't agreement. You can fully understand someone's view without sharing it. That's what makes it powerful.

climax.text: Practice: reflect emotions, not just facts. Say 'That sounds frustrating' before jumping to solutions. Validation first.

punchline.text: People don't need you to fix them. They need you to hear them.

quiz.question: What distinguishes empathic listening from active listening?
options: It focuses on facts over emotions
It hears emotions and what isn't being said
It requires agreeing with the speaker
